title: PHPaddcslashes()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPaddcslashes()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Add a backslash in front of the character "W": Definition and Usage The addcslashes() function returns a string with backslashes in front of the specified characters. Note: The addcslashes() function is case-sensitive. Note: Be careful using addcslashes() on 0 (NULL), r (carriage return), n (newline), f (form feed), t (tab) and v (vertical tab). In PHP, \0, \r, \n, \t, \f and \v are predefined escape sequences. Syntax addcslashes( string,characters ) Parameter Values Parameter Description string Required. Specifies the string to be escaped characters Required. Specifies the characters or range of characters to be escaped Technical Details Return Value: Returns the escaped string PHP Version: 4+ More Examples Example Add backslashes to certain characters in a string: "; echo addcslashes($str,'m')."
"; echo addcslashes($str,'H')."
"; ?> Example Add backslashes to a range of characters in a string: "; echo addcslashes($str,'A..Z')."
"; echo addcslashes($str,'a..z')."
"; echo addcslashes($str,'a..g'); ?> ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
"; echo addcslashes($str,'m')."
"; echo addcslashes($str,'H')."
"; ?>

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
"; echo addcslashes($str,'A..Z')."
"; echo addcslashes($str,'a..z')."
"; echo addcslashes($str,'a..g'); ?>

quiz.question: What is function?
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of function is 'case-sensitive'.

quiz.question: What is v?
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of v is 'predefined escape 
sequences'.
